item.title: Bug Bounty
item.description: Bug bounty A bug bounty for security flaws is hosted on YesWeHack platform. On the 25th of May 2023, due to a high number of vulnerabilities reported recently, we are pausing the program for now in order to be able to process them qualitatively. Visit the Bug Bounty page This bounty program covers code from the GitHub repository PrestaShop/PrestaShop and all PrestaShop modules defined in the composer.json file. Informations about qualifying and non-qualifying vulnerabilities can be read on the bug bounty page.

item.title: Security policy
item.description: Security Policy Obviously, PrestaShop project security is a critical matter. Project members are dedicated to keeping a high level of security in every aspect of the software. However a software without vulnerability does not exist, which is why there is a security report process. If you find a security issue, please follow it to responsibly disclose your findings. Reporting a Vulnerability Security issues can be reported by sending an email to security-core@prestashop.

item.title: Security release process
item.description: Security release process Here is a short summary of the steps followed by the security team: Security issues are reported to security-core@prestashop.com or through the Bug Bounty Program. Security issues are assessed to identify their criticality level. Minor issues are scoped to be fixed in the next scheduled minor release Critical issues are scoped to be fixed as soon as possible For both minor and critical issues, a GitHub Security Advisory will be created to register the issue in GitHub CVE database.
